body:
Dear Mostapha Sadeghipour Roudsari,



I have found [this paper](http://www.ibpsa.org/proceedings/BS2013/p_2499.pdf) about ladybug. What about Butterfly? There is a paper to use eventually as a reference? 



Regards,

Francesco
topic: Butterfly: there is a research paper that can I eventually include as a reference?

replies.body: Currently there is none but if you check page 3134 in the link that you shared there is a reference to butterfly as an under development tool. It has now changed and we had to re-write everything from the scratch. Let me know if you need to know anything in particular about the butterfly development.

if you check page 3134 in the link that you shared there is a reference to butterfly

Yes, I have read the reference to the Butterfly. 

I thought there was a more recent and detailed reference about Butterfly.

Let me know if you need to know anything in particular about the butterfly development.

Ok, if I need, I'll contact you.

Regards,

Francesco

Just to make sure my comment wasn't misleading, the reference in the paper should not be used for the current butterfly, as this project started as a fully new project after EFRI-PULSE project was so delayed to open-source the initial project. We had a very long pause waiting for them to do so but it never happened. You can see the development pattern [here](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Butterfly/graphs/contributors).
